= = = Carboniferous and Early Permian = = = 
The Carboniferous and Early Permian time spans were an age of transition. For many organisms, the Carboniferous was a time of abundance, with a diverse range of species filling the landscape. By the Permian, however, the faunas were becoming more restricted, with fewer species present, although with larger body sizes. The Permian extinction at the end of the period was to prove to be the most severe of the Phanerozoic, leading to a major faunal turnover. 
The Devonian and Carboniferous had been an age of relative stability for plants, with few major shifts in the diversity of groups.

Can you explain the concept of context switching in the Linux process scheduling? 
Context switching in the Linux process scheduling is the process of saving the current state of a process and restoring it to that state when it is resumed. Context switching is required when a process is scheduled to run on a CPU and is not currently running.
When a process is scheduled to run, the CPU must save the current state of the process (such as the register values and memory contents) so that it can be restored when the process is resumed. This process of saving and restoring the process state is called context switching.
Context switching is an important part of the process scheduling algorithm in Linux. It allows the operating system to efficiently manage the execution

He was particularly impressed by the depiction of Nazi hunter Emmanuel Lieber and his role as an " eternal scapegoat ", and of the manner in which the book " confounds expectations " by its " fluid narrative structure ", " many narrative levels ", and " seamless transitions " between the past and the present. Rosenfeld praised the " deeply symbolic " characters and their relationships, and he also praised the " unforgettable " physical descriptions of the swamps and jungles. Rosenfeld believed that The Portage " becomes a work of timeless beauty and humanity " and that it is " one of the most significant American novels of the twentieth century ". Remarketing is a method of using pin-point advertising to stay in front of known prospects, or even those who anonymously visited your website.
You’ve probably experienced remarketing when you were shopping on Amazon, then left without buying. Later that day, while you were visiting a completely different website, you saw an ad for the exact thing you were looking at on Amazon.
Remarketing is a way of keeping your name in front of your potential customers even after they leave your site.
When they leave your site, you can use Google Adwords to target them with ads for products that they are likely to be interested in.
This is done by using a specific piece of code on your site that is connected to your Adwords account. Every time someone visits your site, their browser connects to Google’s servers to verify the code.
If the code is present, the browser receives a cookie which allows Google to track that person and target them with ads on Google and their partner sites.
